modName: Full screen DSR resolution scaling fix
summary:
Fix DSR full screen scale with bBorderless=0 (true native full screen)
Fix DSR scaling issue with FullScreenMode=1 (windowed fullscreen mode) for Witcher3
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ffffff][font=Arial]-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Installation: Copy Dsr_scale_fix.exe to Skyrim game folder.[/font][b][color=#ff7700]
Use Dsr_scale_fix.exe to launch game[/color]
[/b]Also support: Fallout4, Witcher3[b]
[/b]---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[color=#ffffff][b]
[/b][/color]Available command line arguments: [b]-SF[/b] [b]0,0,0,0[/b] [b]-DSR[/b] [b]Width Height[/b]
([b]-SF [/b]and [b]0,0,0,0[/b] for Skyrim/Fallout4 only)
use[b] -DSR [/b][b]Width Height [/b]to run game without modify game config
use[b] -SF [/b]to fix vertical stretching
[b][color=#ffffff]0,0,0,0 [/color][/b]custom options (can help in some cases)
Valid range of values  for [b]0,0,0,0[/b] is [b]0[/b] and [b]1 [/b](you can experiment)
[u]Examples:[/u]
You can create shortcut for Dsr_scale_fix and add needed arguments...
Dsr_scale_fix.exe [b]1,0,0,0[/b] [b]-DSR[/b] [b]2715 1527[/b]
Dsr_scale_fix.exe [b]-SF[/b] [b]-DSR[/b] [b]2715 1527[/b]
Dsr_scale_fix.exe [b]0,1,0,1[/b][b][u]
[/u][/b]Do not use [b]-SF [/b]with any[b] 0,0,0,0
[/b]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/color][b][color=#ffffff]
Main page link:[/color][color=#ffff00][size=4] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/33458]Full screen DSR resolution scaling fix[/url]﻿
[/size][/color][/b][color=#ffffff]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/color]
[url=https://www.microsoft.com/en-US/download/details.aspx?id=56116][color=#ffff00][Required NET Framework 4.7.1][/color][/url]
author: Kuzja80

files.name: Dsr resolution scaling fix
files.changelogHtml:
Added Witcher 3 support (fix scaling issue with FullScreenMode=1)
Minor fixes
